author: cbs8
title: ProLeader was released by Pixel Film Studios for FCPX
text:
Pixel Film Studios announced the release of ProLeader for Final Cut Pro X .
Aliso Viejo, CA (PRWEB) October 14, 2015
ProLeader comes packed with content. Each of ProLeader's 30 presets are designed to fit a unique style that stands out from other styles. This means every preset has a specific purpose and it allows users to lead into videos of all kinds. Choose from a variety of styles including minimalistic, retro, vintage, standard, digital, art media, film, analog and many more.
Add one or stack multiple overlays on top of ProLeader presets to enhance them with stylizing effects. Add film damage to create vintage, old film looks or add static and some shake to simulate retro, manual, and analog equipment. Utilize tech overlays, flares, and glitch effects to further stylize, or add pencil and chalk effects to create artistic looks.
Users can resize, re-position and rotate any of ProLeader's 30 presets using intuitive on-screen controls. Scale in inner rings using the inner radius on-screen control and scale the entire effect by sliding the outer radius control. Colors, replications, widths, textures and more can be manipulated using the controls in the inspector window.
ProLeader was professionally designed to work seamlessly inside of Final Cut Pro X . As a generator effect, each ProLeader preset can be dragged and dropped into the timeline and previewed in real time. Users can then add overlays by finding them in the titles menu and dragging them into the timeline. With the parameters found in the FCPX inspector, users can make further adjustments with a few clicks of the mouse.
Established in 2006, Aliso Viejo, California-based Pixel Film Studios is an innovative developer of visual effects tools for the post-production and broadcast community. Their products are integrated with popular non-linear editing and compositing products from Apple FCPX. Apple, the Apple logo, Mac OS X, and Macintosh are registered trademarks of Apple Inc. in the U.S. and/or other countries. All other trademarks and trade names are the property of their respective owners.
